mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to William Smith, 1757 December 22
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: On the heels of his return from the French and Indian War and recovery from a life-threatening illness, Washington wrote to Smith and provided a list of subscribers, including himself, to the American Magazine and Monthly Chronicle for the British Colonies. About a month prior, Smith sent Washington volume one, number one (October 1757) in hopes that Washington would review it for accuracy of Fort Necessity, the French and Indian War, Braddockâ€™s defeat, and the Ohio Company; as well as commit to being a subscriber. Autograph letter signed, 2 pages.
